Entities.Name: Attribute
Entities.Definition: Descriptors for clinical findings or procedures such as quality or state (e.g., left, hard, weak).

Entities.Name: Qualifier/Temporal Modifier
Entities.Definition: Modifiers that indicate timing, degree, or negation (e.g., strong, frequent, not).

Entities.Name: Fraction
Entities.Definition: Expressions indicating ratio or frequency terms like 'per', '/' or 'every'.

Entities.Name: Patient
Entities.Definition: Mentions of the patient or aliases used to refer to the patient.

Entities.Name: Time unit
Entities.Definition: Units of time relevant to clinical documentation.

Entities.Name: Medication
Entities.Definition: Medications mentioned, including brand names and generics.

Entities.Name: Medical Test/Procedure
Entities.Definition: Tests or procedures such as CTG, blood tests, etc.

Entities.Name: Cervix
Entities.Definition: Mentions of cervix, abbreviated or full forms.

Entities.Name: Range
Entities.Definition: Phrases indicating a range, such as from–to.

Entities.Name: Complaint/Pain
Entities.Definition: Mentions of patient discomfort or pain.

Entities.Name: Blood Loss
Entities.Definition: Mentions of vaginal or general blood loss.

Entities.Name: Amniotic Fluid Loss
Entities.Definition: Mentions of amniotic fluid discharge or loss.

Entities.Name: Length Unit
Entities.Definition: Units of length such as centimeters or fingers.

Entities.Name: Mass Unit
Entities.Definition: Units of mass or weight.

Entities.Name: Baby
Entities.Definition: Mentions of the fetus, child, or baby.

Entities.Name: Sleep
Entities.Definition: Mentions of rest, naps, or sleep.

Entities.Name: Contractions
Entities.Definition: Mentions of uterine activity or contractions.

Entities.Name: Volume Unit
Entities.Definition: Units indicating volume.

Entities.Name: Way of Application
Entities.Definition: Drug administration routes such as oral or IV.

Entities.Name: Condition
Entities.Definition: Medical conditions like diabetes or HIV.

Entities.Name: Cardinal Numbers
Entities.Definition: Written or numeric cardinal values.

Dataset.Name: PRETURN Dataset
Dataset.Description: Free-text and semi-structured medical notes from 949 pregnancies (24–37 weeks gestation) collected at Ghent University Hospital. Includes 3381 annotated notes with 13,105 clinical concept mentions.

AnnotationGuidelines.Description: Clinical entities were annotated using a custom ontology optimized for preterm birth risk prediction. Weak and strong supervision were used, with mappings to UMLS CUIs and bootstrapped from seed terms and word embeddings. spaCy and rule-based grammar patterns were used for extraction and semantic parsing.
AnnotationGuidelines.Link: No direct link provided, but based on internal tools and UMLS mapping.
